Name: Dreamcatchers in the Secret Gardens
QuestDesc:
The Dreamer seals her heart and surrenders to a world of dreams beyond mortal sight. In this hidden realm built upon melancholy melodies, she walks a path of fragile hope and delusions without looking back. But the dreams she longs to realize have long been tangled up in shadow and deceit. Beneath the lofty facade of the Orchestrator, who seems to have everything, is but a wretched, pitiful soul, drowning in her own illusions.

In the end, will this dream of blooming and withering be a sweet reverie or a haunting nightmare?

Dialogues.Speaker: Breen the Screen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Still buzzing about the last Great Agon? Can't wait to see your Gladiators in action again?

Dialogues.Speaker: Breen the Screen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Open Tournament is on the horizon, and the qualifiers are underway! This is your chance to witness the rise of new legends!

Dialogues.Speaker: Breen the Screen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Solis is bringing you live coverage of every match, and best of all, drinks are on the house for the entire tournament!

Dialogues.Speaker: Breen the Screen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come grab a seat and enjoy at Solis!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Qualifiers, huh? Sounds like a blast.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Want to check it out?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heck yeah! Free drinks? I'm there!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I thought you wanted to watch the matches…

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And we will! Just with a drink in hand. Come on, let's get going!

Dialogues.Speaker: Agon Broadcast
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the end of this match, the Scratchy will have extended their winning streak to 21. Despite the name, this team of young outlanders has made it this far without a single scratch.

Dialogues.Speaker: Agon Broadcast
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And their next challenge? Vulcan Mining, one of Septimont's most established teams. Will victory smile on the Scratchy once again? Stay tuned…

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hm? Who's calling?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's from the Black Shores... Let's find a quieter spot.

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, we have Cartethyia's inspection report here.

Options.PlotLineKey: Have you figured out what happened to her?

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unfortunately, not yet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since this case is unprecedented, we'll need more time to fully understand it. But we've confirmed a few things.

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After merging the power of the Sentinel and the Threnodian, she subconsciously absorbs nearby energy whenever she uses her Forte.

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Last time, she fought in a Sonoro Sphere tainted by the <te href=851023>Dark Tide</te>. This may explain why she felt the Threnodian's pull growing stronger.

Options.PlotLineKey: Perhaps this is exactly what the Fractsidus was after.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm alright. Please don't worry about me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No challenge is too great when your will is strong!

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Trust in science for a simpler solution, Miss Cartethyia.

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For now, she should avoid using her Forte.

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Based on the data you sent back, the Inverted Tower may be the ideal place for her recovery.

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. That Sonoro Sphere's formation is connected to Imperator, which should help stabilize Cartethyia's energy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Also, during her examination earlier, Cartethyia sensed traces of the Leviathan's residual energy again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. It felt the same as the power I sensed when fighting Mya.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I couldn't pinpoint the source, but it seemed to come from somewhere south of the Black Shores, deep underwater.

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're narrowing down the search. Once we have a location, we'll inform you immediately.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll set out now. Just send me the rough coordinates.

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Understood. I'll notify our contact to arrange transport for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please be very careful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After hearing from the Black Shores and Cartethyia, you learn that the residual energy of the Threnodian Leviathan still lingers in the distant depths of the sea. Time to investigate.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Energy similar to the Threnodian's power in Mya's body… Does that mean Mya wasn't the only one?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, where to next?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The dock. It's time to set sail.

Dialogues.Speaker: Black Shores Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, we've located the source of the residue and sent the coordinates to your Terminal. A ship is also ready, and you should see it nearby.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Got it. I'm on my way.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I still don't know what the Fractsidus is planning.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But whatever it is, it definitely involves Rinascita. I'm counting on you to investigate further.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You will find no escape from the storm ahead.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These coordinates bring us closer to Ragunna.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Should we hit up our friends there for a hand? They might know a thing or two about this.

Options.PlotLineKey: It's better we handle this ourselves.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The more people involved, the more attention we might draw from the Order. Their eyes are everywhere, including on our friends.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, we've seen before how the Rinascitans are more vulnerable to the Threnodian's power. If they get involved, it could put them in danger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Right... that makes sense.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahhh... it's all so quiet. Still no sign of the Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, just holler if you need me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Greetings, Righteous One. If unanswered questions have left you wary, allow me to guide the path before you.

Options.PlotLineKey: What brings you all the way here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the Divinity's blessing, I follow Their words, for I am bound to Their will.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Blasphemy! I see now how the faithless have led you astray, coaxing you to abandon the righteous path.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm not here to play games. Cut to the chase, what are you after?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rinascita must be unified and purified, for only then can its people be free from fear and division.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As Their grace and divine will shine upon us once more, so too has Their divine power returned from the faithless lands of Septimont.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With this power, I will unite the divided minds and build a paradise where tears no longer fall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Join me in this great cause, Righteous One. This is also a chance to rid yourself of a foe that has long plagued you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, so you and the Fractsidus can't agree on how to split the Threnodian's residual energy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I serve Their will. It is the only true path.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for the hubristic faithless, they deserve no salvation... nor will they obstruct my course...

Options.PlotLineKey: I can smell it—whose blood have you spilled?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Despite our shared enemy, you still choose conflict over cooperation.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha, I trust what I see. There is no need for me to ally with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You run into Fenrico in your voyage to locate the Threnodian's residual energy. He subtly suggests teaming up, perhaps even joining his cause, to fight a common enemy: the Fractsidus. Yet given the past events, you choose not to trust him and reject the offer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Gondola sets sail from Septimont toward the far away destination.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Is this the right way...?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The door doesn't budge.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The door doesn't budge.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even if you opened it, you'd find nothing but a dead end.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (No, forcing my way through won't work.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I should try my luck elsewhere.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Fabricatorium of the Deep... It belongs to the Order.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Is Phrolova an intruder or the Order's accomplice? Is she after the Gem as well?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Such leniency... is not your style.

Options.PlotLineKey: I need you alive to explain this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're welcome.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The depth beyond reach, where secret treasures often hide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remember the story you experienced in Septimont? The one of the girl lost to the sea?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A soul in defiance of itself, its essence seeping into a brilliant Gem. It drifted here with lingering whispers of resentment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Enchanted, the faithful of the deep followed its call, seeking to claim the divine power as their own.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is a twisted movement in the symphony, and to play it again, your strength is necessary.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The Threnodian's residual energy in the sea came from Mya... and it crystallized inside a Gem?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You already know what I'm here for, don't you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing but this deserves your stay in such barren waters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is just the beginning. Wandering this unfamiliar sea alone will lead you nowhere, and you'll have no defense against the Order's zealotry.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you proposing a cooperation?

Dialogues.Speaker: Pursuer from the Order
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thought I heard something over there!

Dialogues.Speaker: Pursuer from the Order
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Search every corner!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll take care of the Order's guards first, then we'll discuss the Gem's whereabouts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course. Even if everyone here stood against you, none would truly rival your power.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alas, time slips through our fingers. Were I granted the luxury, I would wait for my injuries to heal and reclaim everything myself, rather than risk it all to save you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You might find the right path on your own, but listen closely... Hear those distracting footsteps? They will never cease pulling you astray.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the time you finally silence the noise and find your way, what you seek may already be lost.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The choice is yours.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Think you can turn the tide with words alone? Nice try.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pursuer from the Order
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing there!

Dialogues.Speaker: Pursuer from the Order
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What about over there?

Options.PlotLineKey: (Try to search for another way yourself.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Glad you made the wise choice.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remember, it's just for now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Be my guest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You find yourself in a strange place beneath the sea, realizing it was Phrolova who had saved you. Though critically wounded and hunted by the Order, she risked her life to rescue you. She then reveals that Fenrico has the Threnodian's residual energy and offers a deal: since both of you seek to reclaim it from the Order, why not work together? Time is running out. With Phrolova injured and your surroundings unknown, cooperation seems to be the best option for both of you. The pursuers are closing in, and Phrolova is waiting for your answer...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lost your way?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There is still one path you've left unturned.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Say again, please?

Options.PlotLineKey: I agree to work with you, for now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shall we?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No other way out. Only one choice left...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everything is made of frequencies. Once the melody is distorted, its rhythm is skewed. No blunt force can ever rectify it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unless one orchestrates its essence anew.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You encounter a distorted door. Phrolova uses her Orchestration ability to briefly change its state as she explains how her ability works.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The same door again...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Time your moves carefully.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That way, you can shift its state at will.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pursuer from the Order
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're here!

Dialogues.Speaker: Pursuer from the Order
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You, open that gateway...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Out of the question.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pursuer from the Order
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even if you don't... the Primus will be there... You'll never get the Gem...

Options.PlotLineKey: Fenrico wants the Gem for himself?

Dialogues.Speaker: Pursuer from the Order
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is... the only way!

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leave them be. They won't wake.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mismatched rhythms, twisted frequencies. Both are signs of the Gem's touch.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How vexing. After all this time chasing me, they still haven't learned to let go.

Options.PlotLineKey: Is that where you got your injuries?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm just surprised the Order dared to target you. I thought they'd behave before the great Laureate.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Spare me the commentary. Fenrico wants the Gem, and I intend to stop him. That's all that matters. Now, lead the way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We should leave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will clear the mist and reveal the path before you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The blades of ignorance and chaos are yours to shatter.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Orchestrating here should get us through, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (This is much faster.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (But how long can she keep this up?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It will be faster this way.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Didn't expect to take this route.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Transport channels aren't just for goods.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Order has tried every possible way to block us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sure you've learned how to handle it by now.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's wrong?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Nothing.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Why are Fractsidus members here?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Finish them.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you sure?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those ensnared by the discordant melody only strike out blindly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No use to me, no reason to spare.

Options.PlotLineKey: Is this how our cooperation will end?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why? Are you afraid?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There is nothing to fear. The worst that awaits is simply death.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When we joined the Fractsidus, we accepted that this day might come.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Me, them, every one. We're all the same.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not sure if that's absolute loyalty or sheer indifference to life.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Indifference, you say?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The closer you come to death, the sharper the weight of life cuts to expose what you truly desire.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phrolova doesn't even bat an eye at the death of her fellow Fractsidus members. You start to question how working with her will end. Phrolova, however, explains that every Fractsidus member has been braced for death since the day they joined. While some might see this as disregard for life, she sees it as truly understanding life's value—by facing death, they discover what they truly desire.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...What a cacophony.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Strange.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pursuer from the Order
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're here!

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Noisy...

Dialogues.Speaker: Pursuer from the Order
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take them down!

Dialogues.Speaker: Leah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No—!

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeschylus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wake up, my love! It's me! Can't you recognize me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeschylus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phrolova, it's happening again...

Dialogues.Speaker: Leah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's time for the rehearsal… I don't want to go… No… Don't go…

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've found the way. Soon, I'll bring you all back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Leah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't leave me... Take me with you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeschylus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My child, no one can escape death. Let go of what we've told you. In the end, we're all bound to face it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeschylus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …And perhaps the only thing left for us is to accept it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aeschylus, over all these years, each of you has spoken to me in contradictions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Words of surrender, of perseverance, of fear, of pleading…

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fate is fickle, ever ready to devour. Death comes swiftly, without warning...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...And in its shadow, I have seen you at peace, in fear, in sorrow… and in madness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But worry not, for I am here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will always be here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeschylus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phrolova, my poor child...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (How many times has it been? How many times has he tried to let go, only to tighten his grip again?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Life is as fragile as trembling leaves caught in winter's breath, their quiet cries swallowed by the wind.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The more fleeting, the harder to judge if our choices were ever right. To find meaning in them, one must first walk a path that stretches into "forever.")

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (With a soul reaching toward the world's end, like mine... and like {Male=his;Female=hers}…)

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Even when lost at a crossroads, there's no need to despair. No matter how far you've gone, you can always turn back and find your way home.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phrolova suffers from another hallucination while using her ability despite her injury. This time, she is shown the chaotic, desperate minds of people from the past facing death. She comforts them, and after a brief moment of pain, she quickly recovers to continue the search for hope.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They shouldn't be here, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, but given how twisted the melody is, anything could happen here.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is this the Gem's doing?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's Fenrico's.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We must return to the tower before Fenrico finds it.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What exactly are your people planning here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My... people?

Options.PlotLineKey: You know this place too well, and the Fractsidus have a heavy presence here.
Don't tell me you have nothing to do with all this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why do you care?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now I'm intrigued. Tell me, if death were closing in, what would be your final thought?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A person? A memory? Words left unsaid? Or perhaps, regrets too late to mend?

Options.PlotLineKey: You still haven't answered my question.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, that look. You thought of something just now. A desire unfulfilled, yet still haunting you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But what if I told you that even the most irreversible fates could "start over"?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, how careless of me... I forget I'm speaking to someone who chose to wipe their own past...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here, we shall witness the advent of the Lost Beyond.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A land of serenity, harmony, and perfection... A sphere beyond the reach of time... A new world never to be marred by tragedy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How crude. That name strips it of its poetry and warmth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I composed it, note by note. And within the tower, it opened its arms to the world for the first time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It is my chance to mend what was broken, to fulfill every wish I could never make true.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet for the Lost Beyond to truly endure, for its melody to bring joy, it still needs a divine "texture."

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. Only with the texture can each movement resonate in perfect harmony. Only then will this new symphony truly come to life.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But Fenrico smothered its first breath before it could even cry out. I won't let him twist its melody to serve his own ends.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Deep within the Lost Beyond.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the last of my strength, I cast it into the depths and sealed the gateway leading to the tower.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I cannot claim it, no one shall.

Options.PlotLineKey: If it's hidden in the Lost Beyond, why are you worried?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sealing an entire realm drained my power. When my strength failed, the Order's betrayal was no longer a mere sting, but a blade, heavy and sharp.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But with every strike, I saw things more clearly... Yes, I could not resist the pull of the next blade.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I cannot fall. The immortal Divinity within grows and writhes. It will not remain caged forever behind that gateway.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Lost Beyond will return.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you're saying the Order might get to the Gem before us?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Without the full picture, I can't trust you so easily.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, trust...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How absurd, to speak of trust between us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There is only one Gem.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No matter how this unfolds, we'll see which of us walks away with what they desire.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where should we go next?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This path is a shortcut, but difficult to pass through.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That one takes longer, but may be smoother.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In truth, either will take us...

Options.PlotLineKey: The shortcut, then. I'll handle whatever comes.
Don't act like my choice doesn't matter to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh... if you insist.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phrolova points you toward the Lost Beyond, where the Threnodian's residual energy lies. She reveals all she has done here and tells you about Fenrico's betrayal and his plot against her. Their broken alliance with the Order forced her to temporarily seal the Threnodian's energy within the Beyond. It significantly diminished her power, leaving her vulnerable and thus injured.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fenrico wanted to keep this place under wraps. There may be more to it than meets the eye.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's take a look up ahead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There shouldn't be any interference from here on out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A harmonious tune shall unveil the path forward.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But along the seabed, the melodies have been distorted, tangled beyond recognition.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Restoring them will take time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Steel yourself for the twisted hymn.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How do you know what lies ahead?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The area before us is vital to the Order. Fenrico wouldn't leave it lightly guarded.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ready your blade.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: More guards, just like you said.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're all yours.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The frequencies of these Order Echoes feel unnatural.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Order created them. They know how to warp them just as easily.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is this place?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It is where the Order of the Deep crafts Common Echoes.

Options.PlotLineKey: Are we supposed to pass through here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. The Orchestration Altar is there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Keep your eyes sharp. The mist is another trap they've set for us.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So let's avoid it. Which way is faster?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The left one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Still in doubt?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The right one seems closer and safer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Suit yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You reach the key area where Common Echoes are created. Phrolova warns you to avoid the dangerous mists, but the two of you disagree on which path to take.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Made up your mind?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's proceed.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That was close...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remember, the essence of all things can be altered.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: See, doubt made the hand on the dial move two more ticks.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remember, the essence of all things can be altered.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: <te href=851022>Echo Brooders</te>.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To create Rinascita's Common Echoes from the twisted fragments of Tacet Discords and Echoes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Born in chaos, yet shaped to be amiable and useful. How interesting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A touch of vibrancy woven into ruin, an opus of life that lasts for an eternity…

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The art of reshaping frequencies is far more fluid than one might think.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And... brimming with vitality.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You find the Echo Brooders where Common Echoes are being incubated. Phrolova explains how it all functions.

Options.PlotLineKey: How did you know they would emerge?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I heard the restless discordance.

Options.PlotLineKey: Sharp ears… I didn't catch a thing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There are whispers that reach me beyond these…
(It hurts... Phrolova... I don't want to be here...)
(Take us away... Only you... Only you can...)
(Don't leave us... Don't leave us here...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You question how Phrolova knew of the Echo attack in advance, to which she explains she heard a restless discordance and much more. Fragmented whispers echo in her ears.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We should be able to take the rail here, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hm? Ah, wait a moment, I'll activate it first.

Chapters.Title: Use the cable to activate the rail

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (She clearly drifted off just now. What was that about?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Is this… really the right path?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I need to stay sharp and quickly get a handle on this place to be sure of my way forward.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Leah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Careful now, my child. Watch your step.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Time to switch the rail.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Got it.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (She seemed to have just noticed it… strange.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I time it right, the way forward might reveal itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here it comes again…

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The same trick should do.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well then… seems we'll have to do this together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Very well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Leah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phrolova, you're back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeschylus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You don't look well, child. Did something happen?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing to worry about. {Male=He;Female=She} will take care of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I heard your murmurs just now… You didn't seem this frightened the last time we met, Leah.

Dialogues.Speaker: Leah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Frightened? Heh, nothing gets under my skin at this age.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What about... death?

Dialogues.Speaker: Leah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, now there's a true demon. Always unwelcome, always reminding you of the shortness of our days and the regrets we can't mend.

Dialogues.Speaker: Leah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How I'd love for this merry life to last forever, for things to never change, and for no one to take their leave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Triss
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's not right! If I've fulfilled my one true purpose, then death could never scare me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Melissa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, not this nonsense again, Triss! Come on, dinner's ready!

Dialogues.Speaker: Melissa
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phrolova, it's time to go home for dinner! Your parents must be waiting for you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My parents... waiting for me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeschylus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, Triss's words remind me of myself fifty years ago. Wouldn't you say, Leah?

Dialogues.Speaker: Leah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aye, she spends far too much time with you…

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you think now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Aeschylus
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now? I just want to watch a few more sunrises with my Leah.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My, my. I thought the meticulous Rover was supposed to be flawless in battle.

Options.PlotLineKey: And I thought you would never doze off before an enemy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …A crack has appeared on that gateway.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just as Phrolova tries to use her ability, a sudden hallucination shatters her focus. Visions of close people from the past fill her mind. She realizes that the Threnodian's residual energy she sealed away is now causing disturbances in the Lost Beyond.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This one also needs...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll activate it.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How did you know the gateway had cracked?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I felt the disharmony within the Lost Beyond.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That was fast...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How pathetic that most will overlook the smallest of fractures... but for now, time remains on our side.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see you're prepared.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Everything is but a frequency. The living and the dead, Tacet Discord and Echo… In Solaris, they are one and the same.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ("My" existence stands as proof.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Leah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Careful now, my child. Watch your step.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Time to switch the rail.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Got it.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (She seemed to have just noticed it… strange.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The escaped samples have been corrupted by the twisted melodies.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're too hostile… No choice but to take them out.

Chapters.Title: Use the rails to reach the Orchestration Altar

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The melody has returned to its proper rhythm. This place is beginning to restore itself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Soon, it will recover too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Luneau
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I knew we'd make beautiful music together! Another perfect rehearsal!

Dialogues.Speaker: Triss
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hold on, you played ahead of the beat. I heard it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Luneau
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem... Well, Phrolova, your playing and Triss's improvisation were completely in sync! No wonder you're our best violinist!

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's only because... I've played this piece countless times before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Triss
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oi! Don't be changin' the subject now!

Dialogues.Speaker: Noemie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've heard tell you've been asked to perform far from here? I'm sure you'll amaze them all, just like you always do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That performance...

Dialogues.Speaker: Triss
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you alright, Phrolova? You look a bit pale...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Plans have changed, but it's nothing to worry about.

Dialogues.Speaker: Triss
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see... When you can, come back and rest, will you? You've been workin' so hard!

Dialogues.Speaker: Triss
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I remember you said this is the only place you could truly rest. But you're always busy, and sometimes things here get a bit... messy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm here with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Triss, do you want me to keep going with my plan?

Dialogues.Speaker: Triss
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course! I wanna sing and sing forever!

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even though this isn't the home we once knew?

Dialogues.Speaker: Triss
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know it's not. I'm not the same as I was either. I died in an accident, hundreds of years ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Triss
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I still feel me inside, and I can still laugh and sing. It doesn't feel any different.

Dialogues.Speaker: Triss
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know you can do it, Phrolova. You'll bring everyone back, and I'll be right here waitin' for ye. I'll wait for that day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Triss
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By then...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By then, you will stand on an even brighter stage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I'll be here. "Always.")

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This time... Will death be real...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Am I... finally going back...?
But you can't, Phrolova. You can't simply die. Didn't you promise to bring them home?
Phrolova... Phrolova... Wake up...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phrolova... Phrolova!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Losing that much blood and not even trying to treat it... If you really wanted to die, I could've made it quicker for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You deliberately teeter on the verge of death. Are you that desperate to see what you truly desire?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We should move.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phrolova's Orchestration has restored the area, but overusing her ability plunges her exhausted mind into more hallucinations. She finds herself beside her loved ones, playing music and sharing laughter as they accept her every word. Phrolova then faints, thinking the long-awaited death has finally come for her, but you bring her back.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An audio recording here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Reporting Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Primus, Phrolova has reached the final stage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The foundation of the Paradise is complete. It is time to purge those who have strayed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The souls trapped in darkness need a temporary dwelling. For that, we need her work.

Dialogues.Speaker: Reporting Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But Primus…

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You hesitate. Why?

Dialogues.Speaker: Reporting Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is... different from what you told us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Reporting Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You said our goal was to return the divine power within the Gem to the holy sphere. You never mentioned this part.

Dialogues.Speaker: Reporting Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Has the plan changed?

Dialogues.Speaker: Reporting Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Primus? Should I continue the recording?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Recording... When did I ever... I see. No, continue recording.

Options.PlotLineKey: Fenrico's goal isn't just the Gem.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or, more precisely, this man of authority has already sunk deep into the mire of his own confusion.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (This feels a lot like what Cantarella described before.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Is the Threnodian's power driving him toward something?)

Options.PlotLineKey: Why did you create the Lost Beyond?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Because... I made a promise long, long ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You find recordings that reveal Fenrico's scheme to seize the Lost Beyond and the Threnodian's residual energy, which seems to contradict his previous commands. Fenrico appears to notice his abnormality. When Phrolova points out that Fenrico is in disarray, you suspect he has fallen under the Threnodian's influence. You then seize the moment to ask Phrolova about her true reason for creating the Lost Beyond. She simply replies that it was but to keep a distant promise and satisfy an obsession.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A long-lost friend once told me that every promise matters. Once you make one, you see it through, no matter the cost.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, nothing like what you'd call "long ago," I suppose.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And?

Options.PlotLineKey: Maybe it's about keeping a promise. Or maybe it's your own stubbornness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Resonance abilities are tied to emotions. If your stubbornness drove you to create an entire Sonoro, then I'd call it an obsession.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is far from undisturbed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems the chaos has seeped into every corner of the Fabricatorium…

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. The Orchestration Altar is behind that pillar.

Options.PlotLineKey: The water's not deep. Maybe we could walk it through.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Water? It's the energy source that keeps this site running.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hold on. I'll orchestrate this area first. Let's see if the path will reveal itself after the mist is cleared.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (She's trying to use her Forte again… and she looks better now. Her injuries and Resonance ability are recovering.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Our alliance hinges on her weakened state. I'm not sure how long it'll take for her to fully recover… but when she does, this fragile pact could end in an instant.)
If this world can't be changed, then maybe it's time to take a different path... even if it's nothing like before.
I'll do whatever it takes to help you achieve your goal. We stand in the same place, and I've already shown you that what you seek is within reach.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (It's… possible...?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phrolova.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This mist… It's even thicker than before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Things are getting worse in the Lost Beyond?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sonoro Sphere you created seems to be tied to your life.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A sharp observation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Worry not. It won't affect our goal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There is always a way forward. Stay close.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You realize Phrolova is recovering as she uses her abilities more to find a way out. This means the partnership based on her injuries is shattering. Meanwhile, Phrolova continues to see visions while using her ability, an indication to her that the situation in the Lost Beyond is deteriorating, as she and the space are closely connected.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is it that difficult for you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Stand on it and make sure it holds.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It worked.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's keep moving.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Have to time it right during the Orchestration to make it through.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The way these poles are arranged...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Feels too intentional.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look at this.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some kind of sheet music? It looks similar to what we saw back at the Altar.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They are different movements of the same composition. Only when they are all orchestrated can the piece return to its original harmony.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As I mentioned, everything is made of frequencies. Melodies can bend the rhythm of existence, and by orchestrating their essence, we reshape their very nature.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So all this chaos was caused by Fenrico disrupting the composition?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exactly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This piece is the heartbeat of this entire <te href=851020>place</te>. Restore it, and order will return. The pathways between regions will open again.

Options.PlotLineKey: You composed this piece, didn't you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You... recognize this melody?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, but I can tell. You were working with them, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course, you're right.

Options.PlotLineKey: Did you leave any backdoors, just in case?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I didn't, we wouldn't have made it this far.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However... this piece should have been on the Orchestration Altar, but now it's hidden in this Echo Brooder...

Options.PlotLineKey: Good. We can fix them all at once.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...It won't be that simple.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You discover a piece of sheet music. Phrolova explains that this music is the core of the Fabricatorium of the Deep. The area can only be restored by returning it to the Orchestration Altar and fixing the melodies. When you speculate she composed it, she admits it was part of her collaboration with Fenrico. You both then agree to bring the sheet music back to the Altar.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a complete mess...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Energy Hub holds immense power, making it all the more susceptible to distortion.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Energy Hub... Sounds like a key component keeping this place running.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It is.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That way.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The energy leaking from these poles looks dangerous.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Another consequence of the distorted melodies.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then we should be able to stabilize it through Orchestration.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The way these poles are arranged...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Feels too intentional.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We need to Orchestrate here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As expected... two movements are missing. Despicable.

Options.PlotLineKey: There was only one at the place we just passed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then there is only one other place they could be.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They are right beneath our feet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You notice that two more pieces are still missing from the Orchestration Altar. Phrolova proposes heading to the lower levels to search for them.

Chapters.Title: Take the elevator to the lower levels
Reach the lower level of the Energy Hub

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a mess here. How are we supposed to find the movement pieces?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Try to think from the perspective of the one who concealed them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll descend from here. The path ahead should be safe.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Safe, really?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I didn't expect this either.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Echo Brooders, in here?... Stay on guard, just in case they break out and attack.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They won't. They're not fully developed yet.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh? What was that you said?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We should each go our own way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fenrico likely hid the two music sheets separately to stall us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're wondering if this was all a setup to trap you.

Options.PlotLineKey: I can't be sure what's happening in the Lost Beyond.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh… Now I'm even more certain. Fenrico wanted us separated.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If he could craft a snare for us to walk into, why wouldn't he?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Searching together wastes time, but if we're separated, the fragile trust between us could crumble in an instant.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Doubt, dispute, hesitation… such ruinous trappings follow us disquietly to our graves. That's his plan.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I won't let him win. Will you?

Options.PlotLineKey: What do you mean by this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's tied to my power and the only support I have in my weakened state.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even if we're apart, you'll still hold my fate in your hand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Staying here will get neither of us what we want.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't keep me waiting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An accidentally triggered security system separates you and Phrolova. She proposes splitting up to speed up the search. You worry that this might be a trap set by her and Fenrico. To ease your doubts, Phrolova hands you her baton, which holds her remaining Resonance Energy, her only support in her current state. After some thought, you accept her baton and go your separate ways.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An ambush?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha, as expected.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pointless.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This device looks the same as the ones I saw earlier.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We can adjust the water level and get out from the passage above.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a bit tricky without a guide...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not if I'm here!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you sleep well?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mhm! Feeling great!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But where are we now? So many twists and turns, it's making me dizzy...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's figure this out together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Roger! Roger!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hah, that wasn't so tough. See? We made it out.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You were about to pass out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No way! Something like that ain't ever taking me down.

Chapters.Title: Continue onward and find the music sheet
Continue onward and find the music sheet

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come on, we need to find the music piece.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What music piece?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a long story…

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright then, I'll keep an eye out. Just make sure you fill me in later!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's probably safe for now. Let's go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Check out all this stuff! We might find the music piece here.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Artificial Sonoro Spheres have a short duration and are unstable. Additionally, the influence of Fortes can cause unintended changes to them."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Creating a large, stable Sonoro capable of sustaining a reality for all, would entail significant costs. Additionally, the process would demand the sustained application of my Resonance ability."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "This research direction has gained solid support and will continue. Recorder: Phrolova."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These records all link to the Waveworn Phenomenon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why did Phrolova even study this?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's a pattern here... She was searching for a way to preserve human consciousness.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And if Fenrico's recording is real, who exactly was she trying to save when she created the Lost Beyond?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You come across old research files on the Waveworn Phenomenon, which appear to be Phrolova's work. Your investigation reveals that she was searching for ways to preserve human consciousness, though you can't tell whose.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why are there so many Tacet Discords?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She can't defend herself. We need to clear the way for her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, why would you even… Ugh, whatever. Maybe trying poking these control devices?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whoa, this can distract them!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look, this can take care of them!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "The frequencies in <te href=851024>Retroact Rain</te> are essentially purer and more stable Remnant Energy. This shows potential."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "The human consciousness retained within the rain is too weak, resulting in only brief, repetitive fragments."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Retroact Rain is unpredictable and cannot independently form Tacet Discords or Echoes capable of maintaining human consciousness on a large scale. Research terminated. Recorder: Phrolova."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Tacet Discords generated by the Dark Tide consist of fragmented frequencies intensely fused together."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "These subjects lack self-awareness. The collective consciousness formed through fusion is entirely shaped and controlled by Leviathan."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "The Dark Tide cannot sustain or preserve original human consciousness. Research terminated. Recorder: Phrolova."

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are these guys guarding something?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like the music piece is nearby.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? Is that Phrolova?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She's talking to someone… but I can't tell who.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, let's keep going.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here it is. We should bring it back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Back? What do you mean?

Options.PlotLineKey: We need to rendezvous with Phrolova.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know what's going on between you two, but maybe you should do this yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Her frequency smells… off.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Off?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's safer for you to stay in my Tacet Mark and keep watch. This place is unstable, and the Threnodian is still at work.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Copy that. Be careful out there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You find a piece of sheet music and prepare to meet up with Phrolova, but Abby warns you about her strange frequency. Given the unpredictable dangers of the underwater environment, you tell Abby to return to your Tacet Mark but to stay alert.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phrolova's perspective.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I didn't expect you to act...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (More guards... and watchful eyes...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I must find another way.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Heh... The more watchful the eyes, the louder their fear sings to me.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (There. My way out.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (When the melody beckons, their eyes may turn away...  and in the hush, the shadow slips through.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Well then... Show me how you conduct your symphony.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Shall we let the music begin?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Patience. I will move when their gaze turns elsewhere.)

Dialogues.Speaker: "Triss"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phrolova, in a bit of trouble, hmm？

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't show yourself with her face, Grand Architect.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Triss"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh? But you used to like it when "I" was like this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why are you here?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Triss"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "I" promised you, didn't I? To let the Elegy from the Beyond sing here, and see "us" reborn again.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Triss"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The frequency in your eye... It hurts, doesn't it? So many voices, so many cries, all echoing in your head...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Triss"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "I" know you can bear it, just like you always have. With your half-human, half-Tacet Discord body, can anything even hurt you, or kill you? But your mind? I don't want you to feel all that pain.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Triss"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And now... the game has changed. After what happened in Septimont, Augusta's made her move.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Disdaining fortune, with Its power clutched in our grasp before Its fall, we shall wield It, and call forth every forgotten soul." That was your promise to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But without Leviathan's power of Unity, I can no longer grant them all a rebirth within the Beyond.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Triss"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, but you still can. You're saving "us" now!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Triss"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "I" just want you to finish Cristoforo's plan first.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Triss"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The seabed is in chaos. Now isn't the best time to bring "us" back.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Triss"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Merging Reverberations with Tacet Discords, keeping "our" consciousness alive while creating new vessels for "us"... Don't you want more time to make it perfect? A true revival, done the right way?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even if I agreed to help you first, {PlayerName} would never allow it.  {Male=He;Female=She} would fight to the end to stop us.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Triss"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Beyond is merging with you. Once you gain the strength to open that gateway, you can keep {Male=him;Female=her} there. With "us." Forever.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Triss"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh? You're hesitating. Is that moment you two shared really more important than "us"?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You misunderstand. A seat in the Beyond has always awaited {Male=him;Female=her}. Trapping {Male=him;Female=her} now changes nothing. In the end, {Male=he;Female=she} will fulfill {Male=his;Female=her} promise to me there.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Triss"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehehe... Hurry up, Phrolova. The Beyond is holding onto you tighter and tighter. I'm scared you won't have much time left.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: While searching for the sheet music, Phrolova encounters the Grand Architect of Fractsidus, who has taken the form of Triss. The Grand Architect suggests that with the unexpected turbulence in the sea depths, plans for the Lost Beyond should be set aside for now. Instead, trapping you to secure the Threnodian's residual energy has become the new priority. Phrolova considers this and then accepts the Grand Architect's command.
The stars never blink... The sun never sets...
When can we leave?
No, I can't do it... I can wait, but when can we...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Silence. I need silence...)

Chapters.Title: Continue onward and obtain the music piece

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phrolova, when this piece is truly complete, I'll come back.
Is that a promise?
Yes. No matter where I am, I'll return.
Every promise matters. Once I make one, I'll see it through, no matter the cost.

Dialogues.Speaker: Welcoming Neighbor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phrolova, don't forget! We're off to the neighboring city tomorrow!

Dialogues.Speaker: Curious Audience
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phrolova, could you tell us the story behind that tune you're conducting?

Dialogues.Speaker: Close Friend
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phrolova, we made a promise. Friends forever, through thick and thin. Neither of us will ever leave the other behind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pessimistic Scholar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phrolova, Reverberations from human death are destined to disperse or distort. If they become Tacet Discords, they're no longer human.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What I couldn't do back then… I can make happen now...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your bones will no longer be marrowless. Your blood will no longer be cold...

Dialogues.Speaker: Distressed Family Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phrolova, keep living… We long to be by your side…

Dialogues.Speaker: Relieved Tutor
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phrolova, I've faith that the melody you weave with your baton will change the world one day…

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, it will...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The world is but a symphony of resonating frequencies. Humans may fall to be Tacet Discords, and Tacet Discords may rise again as humans... There is no divide between us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have long erased that line. So can everyone else.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Lost Beyond's influence on Phrolova intensifies. Visions of people from the past and promises fill her mind... Some voices urge her to yield, but she refuses to give in. Out of stubbornness, she believes the world is but a symphony of resonating frequencies. Humans may fall to be Tacet Discords, and Tacet Discords may rise again as humans—all are but vessels with no true boundaries.

Dialogues.Speaker: Energy Safety System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Intruder alert. Intruder alert. Engaging intercept protocol.

Dialogues.Speaker: Energy Safety System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Target location locked. Initiating Eradication sequence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Energy Safety System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Target location updated. Entering Advanced Eradication Mode.

Dialogues.Speaker: Energy Safety System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Detecting frequent target location updates. Entering Super Advanced Eradication Mode.

Dialogues.Speaker: Energy Safety System
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Target leaving engagement zone. Activating Ultimate Eradication Mode.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (When did {Male=he;Female=she} come?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (That chaos clouded my mind. Did I just...)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Am I orchestrating the right way?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...You have a talent for it.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We can't take the elevator. We need another way up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then let's make the quake spread further, shall we?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you touch something? What caused the explosion?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fenrico tied the music piece to the security system.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh. He'd blow up all the energy here just to stop us. He's really putting everything into this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: May he enjoy the music we prepared for him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An explosion blocks off the elevator to the upper floors. Phrolova instead decides to use her ability to amplify the blast, creating a greater shock wave to propel the two of you upward.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That was precise...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here, as we agreed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You return Phrolova's baton to her.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Can you still orchestrate?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After a short deliberation, Phrolova hands you all the music pieces.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll leave the rest of the Orchestration to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Are the changes here truly coming from the shifts in the melody?"

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Are there hidden plans woven into these pieces?"

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For all your little doubts...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Taking the conductor's baton yourself is the only way you'll believe in what's unfolding here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And that's how we move forward.

Options.PlotLineKey: Alright, I'll wrap up the Orchestration then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You return Phrolova her baton, and in turn, she hands you all the sheet music pieces and entrusts you with the Orchestration. Taking the conductor's baton yourself is the only way to believe in what's unfolding in this place and decide how you both will move forward.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We should be landing around the Gem's location, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Correct.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From what the Order's pursuers said, Fenrico will have his men guarding it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even the most unpredictable story will one day welcome its conclusion. And when that moment comes, we must act.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That will also be the time when you can turn your blade against me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: On your way to the Lumen Tower, some interference makes you stray from the correct path. You find yourself in somewhere unknown.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This wasn't part of the plan, was it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No. Someone interfered. I've never been here before.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then we'd better find a way out quickly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Guiding Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Dear brothers and sisters, you who stand before us shall be an irreplaceable force in Rinascita's salvation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Guiding Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let us join together to spread light to all, and face the Divine Ordeal in unity.

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you one of Fenrico's Acolytes?

Dialogues.Speaker: Guiding Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come, join us! Offer your prayers to the holiest sacred land!

Dialogues.Speaker: Guiding Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Amidst your endless research, do not forsake your faith! Never forget! They are always watching!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (There's no light in their eyes. Just emptiness… and blind devotion.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These fanatics can give you no answers.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why are there so many ensnared Acolytes here?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's check out what's happening.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Agreed.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I didn't expect the Order's rituals to be this elaborate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Elaboration fosters reverence.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fair point.

Chapters.Title: Continue onward and find a way out

Dialogues.Speaker: Devout Acolytes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How do we lead people to worship You?

Dialogues.Speaker: Devout Acolytes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We guide them closer to Your boundless grace.

Dialogues.Speaker: Devout Acolytes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How do we lead people to believe in You?

Dialogues.Speaker: Devout Acolytes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We let them touch Your very soul.

Dialogues.Speaker: Devout Acolytes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come closer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Devout Acolytes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Reach out your hand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Devout Acolytes
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Until you walk with Them.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's an inscription on the altar.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "I am no longer Them. I will lead the people forward."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Imperator's statue is gone… Is this Fenrico's ambition?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The next line reads...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "It reminds us that the Sentinel walks with us, illuminating our path with wisdom."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel… Could this lantern be the very one Napoli the Second used? The one imbued with the Sentinel's power that allowed him to repel the Dark Tide?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You follow a group of Acolytes to a statue, where an altar holds the lantern of Napoli the Second. Upon touching it, you are suddenly teleported into an illusive realm.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (That lantern wasn't real... Where am I?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Where's Phrolova?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take the red gate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He wants to trap us here forever.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phrolova?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm here. Do what I said.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The flickering lights show you the way forward.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If time works against you, then change it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leave the Orchestration to me. You just open the red gate.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Was that reality or an illusion…?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Does it matter? Let's move forward.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A secret space with no visible exit. That can only mean...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There must be hidden pathways.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perfect timing.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, we just unlocked something.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd really like to see what secret is kept in such a place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh. No exit. Only a dead end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: O sinful dream, why do you disturb this tranquil slumber?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The weeping child lingers no more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Instead, she raises her hand and claims that vaporous drop.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take the red gate.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where should we go next?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To the top.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ambush.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is it this time?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (More enemies here. We must be close.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That is...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hurry.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am the first, yet shall be the servant of all.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that... the Dark Tide?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It didn't work...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I remain here to guide the lost and bring true peace to Ragunna.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fenrico can summon the Dark Tide creations?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "From among the faithful, a powerful Harbinger shall arise, bringing both life and annihilation from the Dark Tide into this world..."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He's the Harbinger!

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Gem's power grows.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico & Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Salvation, Ascension, and Unity. This will be the one true path.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico & Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Dry bones, hearken unto my words. I shall cause spirits to enter thee, and thou shalt live again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico & Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hark, O breath of the winds! Bow thee down and yield, ye lost souls!

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico & Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thou shalt walk in my statutes and keep mine ordinances.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico & Leviathan
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The faithful shall not falter. By faith shall their souls be preserved.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even with the body perished, hope and salvation shall endure.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
