Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fenrico, stop! The Threnodian is using you! You are the Harbinger of the Dark Tide!

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Absurd! I stand against it. How could I ever be its puppet?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: O Sentinel! Return the souls in darkness to this world! Let all wills be made one!

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Gem… is fleeing into the Dark Tide?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My predecessors... What you taught... I...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "The path born of injustice must be fortified with further transgressions…"

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hah, no, even with the body perished, hope and salvation shall endure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Righteous One, please, save Rinascita's souls from the Paradise...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your plan won't work.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Says the one who hasn't witnessed the years, the failures, the countless attempts I've made. What gives you the audacity to pass such judgment?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've already tried everything! Can't you see? The path you're on only leads here, nowhere beyond.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Among thousands of paths, surely one will lead me back to them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And even if I'm wrong... I fear not starting over. I've done it time and time again.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What meaning is there in chasing something that's neither realistic nor attainable?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know they're there.

Options.PlotLineKey: I saw them in the Beyond.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those fading Reverberations did not, and cannot, return to life. No matter how long you hold onto their frequencies, the result will be the same.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The villagers are dead. What you've created are Tacet Discords. If you continue turning the entire town into that... you're not creating a paradise. You're creating a hell.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "The villagers are dead..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, you saw them in their human form.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then how can you claim my goal is unattainable?!

Options.PlotLineKey: Your goal is the one the Fractsidus gave you.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's what they forced on you. And the Triss you saw? Fleeting, unstable, an illusion. And yet, you still believe everything they say can become real?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus showed me a way forward.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even if they have their own motives, even if we're only using each other... I care not.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If they can help me take this step, then another step may follow. And another. No matter how steep the price, I'll pay it, step by step, until I reach the end I seek.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Love? Sincerity? Compassion? Trust?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What you and your cronies hold dear is but a jest to the Fractsidus. No bond lasts forever. Without true loyalties, there can be no betrayal, no deceit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I no longer buy into such illusions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After all, even if you believe with all your heart, even if you wait patiently at a crossroads...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The one you're waiting for may have long since forgotten you. Forgotten the promise they swore to keep.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I waited. For a long time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I won't wait anymore.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What was once an unforgettable encounter between us can now be the thread that weaves a paradise for "them."

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've gone too far.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Heh, you're one to talk. How amusing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You, with your long life and its endless possibilities, still choosing to start over, even at the cost of all your memories?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The irreplaceable bonds, the emotions that make us human, are the brightest lights and most precious treasures in our fragile existence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What madness, what cruelty, what impossible goal would drive you to cast them all aside?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've gone further than I ever could.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps you believe more than I do that only in endless time can true, eternal perfection arise. That only then will a brave new world arrive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We walk different paths, yet in the end, we are both driven by the same madness. Why argue who's fallen further?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The only difference is that... you've forgotten it all.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You never understood the true value of human life.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nor have you stepped beyond the boundary that death has placed upon the human soul.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, this is our finale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fenrico is awakened by the visions of his predecessors appearing in the lantern's light. After regaining consciousness, Fenrico exhausts his powers to seal the gateway to the Journeying Paradise, blocking the Dark Tide. With the Threnodian's residual energy separated, you and Phrolova both race for the Gem. You tell her that the dead cannot be brought back and she should abandon her fantasies. Phrolova scoffs at your words, calling you the stubborn one and scorning your inability to step beyond the boundary that death has placed upon the human soul yourself. Unable to convince each other, the rivalry between you and Phrolova continues.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've come home.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Fenrico spoke of a... Paradise. What does it mean?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (And "save Rinascita's souls"... Was he pointing to the source of the anomaly in Rinascita?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I heard curses... not loud, but deep... I deserve them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Soon, It will gather enough strength to herd the people and drown Rinascita beneath the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Gem isn't the true heart of the problem. The false Journeying Paradise has created an illusion of everlasting peace, hiding the real source of the catastrophe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I will remain here to stem the Dark Tide's spread.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, I can sense it clearly. The fluctuations from the Paradise are not in Ragunna, but in Septimont...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I cannot reach that far. I must rely on you to go, find, and solve the crisis there. Only then can those who abandoned their faith save their homeland.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phew, that was exhausting...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't believe it! That gate sent me to some lab so, so far away!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Finally made it back... So? What happened after that? Did we win?

Options.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus got away with the Gem.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What? What should we do now? Let's track them down!

Options.PlotLineKey: Not now. There's something more important.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? What's the bigger deal?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We were after the Gem to find the source of the anomaly in Rinascita.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now we have a better lead—the Journeying Paradise.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That might also explain why the Fractsidus took the Gem and what they're really after.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll head to Septimont to uncover the truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe it's time we spoke with the Ephor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh... Alright. Are we heading back now?

Options.PlotLineKey: We still have to tie up loose ends here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In his last moments of consciousness, Fenrico reminds you that the Threnodian's residual energy isn't the real problem. Rinascita's woes lie in the "Journeying Paradise." He hopes you can prevent this impending calamity and save Rinascita. With this new information, you cease your search for the Threnodian's residual energy and instead plan to return to Septimont for further investigation. As you take one last look at the Fabricatorium of the Deep, wondering what to do with it, a Lycoris suddenly catches your eye.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Once I dreamt that we were dear to each other."

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "I woke to find that we were strangers."
